meanings.definition: The forward part of a ship's deck.
meanings.sent1: The sailors gathered on the foredeck to watch the sunset.
meanings.sent2: The captain stood at the foredeck, scanning the horizon for land.
meanings.sent3: As the waves splashed against the foredeck, the crew couldn't help but laugh.
meanings.sent4: The foredeck was a sturdy shield against the roaring sea.
meanings.sent5: The salty breeze on the foredeck filled their lungs with adventure.

meanings.definition: The area at the front of a boat.
meanings.sent1: The fishermen unloaded their catch on the foredeck of the boat.
meanings.sent2: Passengers enjoyed the view from the foredeck during the cruise.
meanings.sent3: A seagull landed on the foredeck, looking for a snack.
meanings.sent4: The foredeck of the boat was a peaceful retreat from the bustling harbor.
meanings.sent5: The gentle rocking of the boat's foredeck lulled them into a peaceful nap.
